intro: Antistrophe serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf antistrophe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
